definition: and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to keep on the right side of everyone (idiom)/warm and affable
to damage a good relationship/to hurt sb's feelings

sentences.english: She was a very kind and amiable old woman.
sentences.chinese: 他是個善良和氣的老太太。

sentences.english: Can we not compete? We don't injure our harmony.
sentences.chinese: 能不比嗎？大家都別傷了和氣。

sentences.english: I won't hurt the tree, said the woodman kindly.
sentences.chinese: 我不會傷害這棵樹了，樵夫和氣的說。

sentences.english: Be seated somewhere; and until you can speak pleasantly, remain silent.
sentences.chinese: 找個地方去坐着，不會和氣說話就別張嘴。

sentences.english: Talk nicely, be patient and wait for others to finish speaking.
sentences.chinese: 說話和氣，有耐心並等對方把話講完。

sentences.english: Steve cannot be nice without bothering people around him.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫在周圍有很多人的情況下不能保持和氣。

sentences.english: But the character of the two people, there will be no conflict.
sentences.chinese: 但是性格和氣的兩個人，基本上不會有衝突。

sentences.english: Solving problems must rest on principle with a genty manner.
sentences.chinese: 處理問題時要講原則，態度和氣，。

sentences.english: He was very good-humored about the mess my children made of his kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 我的孩子們把廚房弄得一團糟他還是非常和氣。

definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
